meta.title: Funeral Etiquette Guide | What to Wear & How to Act | Barringtons
meta.description: Complete guide to funeral etiquette. What to wear, what to say, how to behave at a funeral. Helpful advice for attending or planning a funeral service.
meta.keywords: funeral etiquette, what to wear to funeral, funeral behavior, funeral customs, funeral traditions

intro.title: A Guide to Funeral Etiquette
intro.subtitle: Understanding funeral customs and etiquette can help you feel more confident during a difficult time.

sections.title: What to Wear
sections.description: While black is traditional, it's no longer mandatory. The key is to dress respectfully:
items: Conservative, modest clothing in muted colors
Avoid bright colors unless specifically requested
Consider the family's wishes - some request colorful clothing

sections.title: What to Say
items: "Thinking of you at this difficult time"
Share a fond memory if appropriate
sections.avoid: Avoid: Asking how they died, saying "I know how you feel", or offering unsolicited advice.

sections.title: During the Service
items: Arrive on time or slightly early
Follow the lead of others for standing/sitting
Sign the book of condolence if present
Children are usually welcome but consider their age

sections.title: Flowers & Donations
sections.description: Check the funeral notice for guidance:
items: "Family flowers only" means don't send flowers
Donations often requested for a chosen charity
If sending flowers, include a simple message
Sympathy cards can be sent to the family home
